Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of woman or child. Mould-made and hollow. Head only. White coating traces. Brown Nile silt fabric with abundant fine gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably locally produced at the Naukratis Terracottas workshop that was operational during the 3rd to 2nd century BC and possibly later. Good parallel from Athribis (Tell Atrib) dated to the late 3rd or early 2nd century BC (Szmańska 2005, no.195) and from Naukratis (Bolton Museum, 1886.31.38). Szymańska, H. 2005. Terres cuites d’Athribis. Turnhout.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.437) (Phase 1)
